author: tokenallies
title: Funding real world Businesses
description: It's hard for businesses and startups to get quick and easy access to funding, impeding many great ideas to be real.

f6_assessments.q0: The project represents a new platform for new businesses to get funding through tokenizing their business. Such projects exist in other chains like Ethereum and it would be a great added value to have them in our ecosystem. The project indeed alligns with the challenge's guidelines since the product is a Dapp that attempts to change classical crowdfunding method into innovative decentralized ways of funding. This project has the potential to have a global impact since the funded project are not limited by any geographical borders or other pseaudo barriers. Furthermore, the ability of the project is unlimited and would only depend on the team's ability to attract great businesses seeking funding and also attract enough interested investors seeking to reach such new projects. And from the team's experience, they seem to be able to overcome these hurdles and scale the project in an appropriate way which will bring new projects to our ecosystem and integrate them with Cardano automatically.
f6_assessments.q1: According to the team's experience and their past funded projects through Catalyst and the links and attachments provided, I feel comfortable saying that the project has a pretty high success likelihood. For starters, the team has an extensive experience in space and more than two funded projects under the same group name: TokenAllies but for other purposes. The team is quite active in the community and has brought a lot of value to the ecosystem. Furthermore, the team provided a monthly plan including weekly milestones specifying what exactly will be done in the organization a development side. Also, the budget presented by the team is quite detailed and includes what will go to what and seems to be fair in terms of the value of expenses and so on. The teams determine two main risks and present a way to mitigate them which wasn't very detailed but is compensated for in the planning side which is very meticulous. I look forward to reviewing an MVP by the team.
f6_assessments.q2: The team has a history of good cooperation on the auditing side. They have at least 2 previously funded projects and have shown a great level of transparency in their development. Furthermore, The community has a very detailed roadmap that extends over three months with weekly milestones that will act like checkpoints that the community can use to see how the team is doing and the progress of their development. Also, the team provides multiple KPIs like providing a wallet connector as soon as the first month and an MVP of the ALLI platform in the second month. While these are ambitious goals the team has the required expertise to make them happen. The team has also provided time frames to provide multiple aspects of the project (i.e wallet connector, ALLI MVP,...). Given all these details, this gives me the confidence to say that this project deserves to e funded and that the community can successfully audit its progress in an easy way.

f6_assessments.q0: This is a great and well written proposal. The team has identified a problem very pertinent to the challenge, the difficulty of small businesses and start-ups to smoothly and cheaply access funding. And have proposed a solution through the use of a product built on top of Cardano which will enrich the ecosystem and attract potentially a lot of new users. The impact of this proposal has the potential to be extremely high and the team has explained in a clear way how it will add value to the Cardano environment. The goals they have defined of implementing an ADA wallet connector, launching the site and generating a Dex integration all align with the outlined challenge. They all move toward the direction of offering a new product to the community, attracting new users and increasing the number of integrations for a seamless experience between products. The only part I would have liked the team to discuss more is their plans for future scalability and sustainability. These are extremely important points for those who have a long-run perspective and if not given enough attention could risk the company/project continuing as a going concern.
f6_assessments.q1: The proposer has provided LinkedIn links for the three members of the team and they have relevant experience in financial markets, software development and project management. In the budget breakdown section, they have clearly outlined how many and each type of members will be required for the implementation of the plan. Also in this section, the necessary funds for each participant and for infrastructure items are estimated and the amounts are all reasonable. The total amount is aligned with the outcome product as well. The timeline of the project is realistic, it is divided in three phases and each of them has clear deliverables. First, they will focus on the ADA wallet connector. Second on the ALLI token site launch. And finally, they'll work on the DEX integration. In general, the plan described is sensible and clearly states the resources that will be necessary. Additionally, the team have also discussed two major risks the project has but have proposed mitigating solutions. One of them is possible developers’ turnovers and the other is problems in the integration. For the first they already have contact with other developers that could be used in case it is necessary and for the second they are open to all possibilities.
f6_assessments.q2: The team proposed a roadmap with clear milestones and achievable timetables. The ADA wallet connector in the first month, the ALLI token site launch on the second month and the DEX integration on the third month. The KPIs provided however are exactly these deliverables. It would be better if they have thought on number of users of the application, total volume of financing for the businesses and number of requests of crowdfunding on their platform. Metrics like that would be more informative and aligned with the challenge. On the other hand, they have provided a link to a site where they claim they will regularly post updates of the project. Additionally, the solution is thoroughly explained and is effective and disruptive. It also aims at the core of the challenge, which is to increase the number of dApps and products available for the community and attract new users to the ecosystem.

f6_assessments.q0: As a vehicle for real world businesses to be onboarded to the Cardano ecosystem via a tokenization proposal that may allow them to leverage additional funding to that available to them, specially in developing countries such as those from Latin America where financing opportunities are scarcer, Token Allies provides for a product which not only enriches the ecosystem, but also allows for onboarding new members and projects.
f6_assessments.q1: As an already existing product with 2 previously funded proposals in Funds 7 and 8, and a proposal team that includes two highly regarded LatAm Catalyst members such as Lucas and Alex (PAs, vPAs, funded proposers, LATAM Cardano Community and LATAM Townhall cofounders, amongst other roles), the development of their second MVP to provide crowdfunding for all with wallet and DEX connectors, leveraging Eternl or GameChanger, and having an already assembled team of developers up to the task, ensure that the proposed timeline and budget will be successfully implemented.
f6_assessments.q2: The proposers suggest as KPIs to track the progress that the ADA Wallet connector will be implemented by the end of the 1st Month, ALLI Token Launch Site will be ready by the end of the 2nd Month, and Dex integration for ALLI will exist by the end of the 3rd Month. Insofar as these are all publicly auditable milestones (involving nothing less than a native token launch and consequent integrations in the Cardano ecosystem), it should be regarded as eminently auditable for the community. Furthermore, if additional information is needed, as hosts of the LATAM Townhall, any member wishing to question them regarding the implementation of this proposal can find them online every Thursday evening, LATAM time.

f6_assessments.q0: The proposal is a straightforward idea that is presented in detail. This has a potentially enormous effect. It is undoubtedly beneficial for the Cardano chain to bring in and onboard ecosystem businesses and products, but it is equally necessary to bring in external firms and developers by offering support in any way that is feasible. And I believe my proposal successfully satisfies those requirements. Cardano's native multi-token blockchain features make it simple to enable finance and liquidity for both the business and the investors. The author suggests creating and offering a platform as a service so that businesses can plan, design, manage, and sell their tokens in order to enable such a phenomenon. This plan will not only add new companies to the chain, but its integration with an appropriate Defi solution will make it simple for ADA holders to make investments in those companies. Therefore, if this project were to be implemented successfully, it would have a significant impact on adding new business owners and smart developers to the chain.
f6_assessments.q1: There is no question about the proposers' expertise because Alex and Lucas are well-known names in the neighborhood. Additionally, it is important to recognize the effort that went into creating the plan. The proposer offers a clear roadmap to the community and readers, complete with resource requirements, hazards to be considered, and quantifiable indicators. The team gives a very quick overview of the team and the experience they might bring to the ecosystem, along with a statement that certain developer and project manager positions have already been filled. When compared to the total budget for the challenge, the requested funds are likewise very acceptable. The breakdown also appears reasonable because the per-head pay is so modest when compared to the developers of competing proposals. Given the evidence at hand, it is clear that this idea has a good chance of succeeding.
f6_assessments.q2: For a proposal of this caliber, there must be extremely obvious signs that money is originally leaving the ecosystem. The authors present phase-by-phase quantifiable metrics, which would simplify the auditing procedure. The proposal's auditing procedure would be completed by the launch of the ALLI token, the integration of the DEX for ALLI, and the author's identification with the greatest amount of caution. Timely updates and reports over the token_allies channels and groups could assist auditors in keeping an eye on the progress. However, establishing what would constitute the proposal's success should have been done more effectively. However, given that it is an extension proposal of a fund7 proposal that has already been financed, a reader may discover evidence to suggest that the team would ensure that the auditing process runs smoothly and that the community would always be aware of the proposal's development.

f6_assessments.q0: This proposal is very useful, it effectively solves the challenge posed. Being able to finance real world businesses could massively boost Cardano's userbase, providing overall investing possibilities in the Cardano ecosystem. ADA Holders will be able to Invest in businesses, buy tokens with their ADA, and the invested company will then become an ADA Holder on its own. With this it will be helping achieve the Challenge objectives by generating new members for the Cardano Ecosystem.
f6_assessments.q1:
Based on the information about the team you provide, they have full knowledge, skills, experience, especially they have had certain achievements: holding many important positions, being funded at fund7 , fund8,... With the above information, I believe your team is fully capable of implementing this project. However, you only provide 3 linkedin links, while your team consists of 7 members. It would be great if you provide more profile information of the rest of the members. This will increase the transparency of the project.
A detailed 3-month roadmap is provided, milestones and to-dos are listed. This will help people have a better overview of the project, thereby giving them more confidence in future success. As for the budget, it would be great if you could clarify more, for example, the number of hours worked, the hourly wage, etc.
f6_assessments.q2:
This is a continuation of a previously funded project in Catalyst. I appreciate you identifying the risks, challenges, and ways to address them. This will be a solid basis for the project to operate effectively.
The information provided is quite complete, detailed, highly authentic, everyone can fully evaluate the success of this project. If it is funded, it will certainly bring tremendous value to the Cardano ecosystem. Thank you for a great suggestion!

f6_assessments.q0: Token Alies is currently developing a platform for crowdfunding small businesses and startups, with the current main goal of delivering the MVP2 of their product, that will include a token website, an ADA wallet connector, and integration with DEXes. The work has been previously funded by the Catalyst project, and current project is a continuation of that work. The solution is well alligned with both Cardano's main pillars and the current challenge, as it aims to develop and improve the already operational infrastructure with basic functionalities for investors searching for investment opportunities. Because of the integration with the ADA token and DEX, the functionality of the platform should improve significantly with this iteration. I believe the solution adds considerable value to Cardano because it promises to solve real business problems and is likely to scale as investors seeking new business opportunities will also be ADA holders, organically fostering further ecosystem adaptation. While the current iteration focuses on LATAM, the team describes the vision to further scale to other continents in the linked whitepaper, indicating the possibility of having a global impact in the long-term.
f6_assessments.q1: The project includes a detailed timetable with specific weekly substeps for delivering the promised products. The white paper's timeframe also specifies both short and long-term goals, indicating a genuine interest in the vision. Another reason the project is likely to succeed is the team's composition, which includes active members of the Catalyst community, a member with multi-year experience with IT development, and members with entrepreneurial and project managing experience, all of which are necessary for the project's successful execution. The pThe white paper and roposal also describe the team members' responsibilities and provide additional information about their experiences on their LinkedIn profiles. In terms of budget, the total requirement is well within the range for this type of project and is well justified, with an exact breakdown of how the specific costs were calculated.In my opinion, the feasibility section is well written, with no important aspects of project execution overlooked.
f6_assessments.q2: The KPIs and deliverables are well defined, with an exact statement of when the deliverables will be completed. Furthermore, the team provides a linktr related to updates about the ongoing activity, implying that the community will be able to monitor the progression. Finally, the project specifies how to mitigate potential risks that could prevent deliverables from being delivered, such as having a funnel of devs ready to replace established developers, and so on.

f6_assessments.q0: the proposal has a goal to provide crowdfunding for all, like small businesses or growth startup can meet with the investor, and they will tokenize the business or startup. tokenization allows business to become digital assets, with this they can sell token to the investor and get quick funding with their business. and this will be programmed through cardano blockchain native multi token capabilities. this gonna be an opportunity to a small company, small businesses, or growth startup to grow quickly.
f6_assessments.q1: this proposal has people who are competent in working on this project. for the budget is clearly understandable but why the budget in the whitepaper 2.0.1 project looks different from the requested budget may be because this 2nd MVP developing. well the budget is reasonable to achieve the goals of this project, and this proposal offers a realistic timetable to complete the project they divide it into quartal and each quartal has progress achievement. this proposal describes the necessary resources to build this project, not only doing role working and what needs going to do. the proposer has considered the challenges and risks relevant to this project, and they explain about delays project because by the exit dev teams will search for another dev, and second, connect integration with Dex is still a problem. when I’m seeing this project it looks promising, well structured, and understandable for non-technical people. I believe this will be implemented successfully.
f6_assessments.q2: still in progress to build this project but for recap key progress indicators are clearly explained and their updates about progress can be seen in this link https://t.co/fj7KDxq835. right now they developing 2nd MVP and I hope their gonna speed up so it became a complete product that can be used

solution: We aim to provide a platform where businesses and startups will be able to easily create, manage and sell their business tokens.
experience: A Strong experience doing digital businesses in LATAM, acquiring unique capabilities & resiliency in complex environments & economic conditions, which enables us to understand & adapt to this culturally diverse region. Key factors when generating trust & interest
